title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: In coming from Parkgate here I intended to accomplish a purpose which Ihave for some years entertained, of visiting Lochwood, the ancient seatof the Johnstones, of which King James said, when he visited it, thatthe man who built it must have been a thief in his heart.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Nothing was written to-day, my writing-desk having been forgot atParkgate, but Tom Crighton kindly fetched it up to-day, so somethingmore or less may be done to-morrow morning--and now to dress.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: _Drumlanrig, August_ 24.--This morning lunched at Parkgate under a veryheavy shower, and then pushed on to Drumlanrig, where I was pleased tosee the old Castle, and old servants solicitous and anxious to be civil.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
